net.nicholaswilliams.java.licensing

Class ObjectSerializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.nicholaswilliams.java.licensing.ObjectSerializer

  • public final class ObjectSerializer
extends Object
    This is a helper class for writing any object and reading simple objects (no arrays, collections, or generic top-level objects) to and from byte arrays.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Nick Williams

    • Constructor Summary

      ObjectSerializer()

      Deserializes an object of the specified type from the provided byte stream.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ObjectSerializer

        public ObjectSerializer()

    • Method Detail

      • readObject

        public final <T extends Serializable> T readObject(Class<T> expectedType,
                                    byte[] byteStream)
                                        throws ObjectDeserializationException
        Deserializes an object of the specified type from the provided byte stream.
        Parameters:
        expectedType - The type that is expected to be retrieved from byteStream (must implement Serializable)
        byteStream - The byte stream to retrieve the object from (it must contain exactly one object, of the exact type passed to expectedType)
        Returns:
        the requested unserialized object, presumably in the stream.
        Throws:
        ObjectTypeNotExpectedException - If the object found in the stream does not match the type expectedType or if a ClassNotFoundException or NoClassDefFoundError occurs
        ObjectDeserializationException - If an I/O exception occurs while deserializing the object from the stream

      • writeObject

        public final byte[] writeObject(Serializable object)
                         throws ObjectSerializationException
        Serializes the Serializable object passed and returns it as a byte array.
        Parameters:
        object - The object to serialize
        Returns:
        the byte stream with the object serialized in it.
        Throws:
        ObjectSerializationException - if an I/O exception occurs while serializing the object.
